result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald L. Hanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald L. Hanson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Donald L. Hanson in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Donald L. Hanson in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Defendant Donald L. Hanson in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz makes statement on motion. Discussion on resolution to both matters. State has no objection to court vacating sentence in 03-CF-056 and resentencing defendant to 3 years IC and 20 years ES. Atty Pelrine makes statement on motion. Atty Reetz asks court to adopt the joint recommendation. Court questions whether victim in 03-CF-56 was notified of todays hearing. State indicates victim wasn't given notice of todays hearing, feels we can proceed to resentence defendant today based on victims wishes at the first sentencing hearing.  Court feels victim needs to have notice of hearing, reschedules matter.  Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defense advises of global offer that involves reopening and modifying 2003 file. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2. Counts 3, 4 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. Sentencing to be conducted in Branch 1 with revocation. State does not need bond.
Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Donald L. Hanson in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Defendant Donald L. Hanson in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defense advises that Defendant will be waiving prelim and entering plea today.
Application, Affidavit, Return, Acknowledgment of Return
